title: Non-aural set, Largo bass - chords in m 12

content.description: The following questions are based on the music below.
content.question: The chords bracketed in measure 12 are best analyzed as

choices.label: The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are Major four dominant in first inversion, Major five dominant in first inversion and minor one.
The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are Major five dominant in second inversion of Major seven, Major five dominant of first inversion and minor one.
The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are minor six half diminished seventh in root position, minor seven diminished seventh in root position and minor one.
The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are Minor two half diminished seventh in second inversion, minor seven diminished seventh in root position and minor one.

content.answer: The figure shows chord progressions. The progressions are Major four dominant in first inversion, Major five dominant in first inversion and minor one.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in notated music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
